Module agent¶

class pypownet.agent.Agent(environment)[source]¶
act(observation)[source]¶

Produces an action given an observation of the environment.

Takes as argument an observation of the current state, and returns the chosen action.

feed_reward(observation, action, reward)[source]¶

Here, the Agent upgrades his policy given the previous observation, its subsequently produced action, and the associated reward. This is where the Agent learns.

class pypownet.agent.RandomLineSwitch(environment)[source]¶
act(observation)[source]¶

Produces an action given an observation of the environment.

Takes as argument an observation of the current state, and returns the chosen action.

Module grid¶

exception pypownet.grid.DivergingLoadflowException[source]¶
class pypownet.grid.Grid(src_filename, dc_loadflow, new_slack_bus, new_imaps, verbose=False)[source]¶
_Grid__vanilla_matpower_callback(mpc, pprint=None, fname=None, verbose=False)¶
_snapshot(dst_fname=None)[source]¶

Saves a snapshot of current grid state into IEEE format file with path dst_fname.

_synchronize_bus_types()[source]¶

Checks for every bus if there are any active line connected to it; if not, set the associated mpc.bus bus type to 4 for the current self.

apply_topology(new_topology)[source]¶

Applies a new topology to self. topology should be an instance of class Topology, with computed values to be replaced in self.

Parameters:new_topology – an instance of Topology, with destination values for the nodes values/lines service status
compute_loadflow(perform_cascading_failure)[source]¶

Given the current state of the grid (topology + injections), compute the new loadflow of the grid. This function subtreats the Octave pipeline to self.__vanilla_matpower_callback.

Parameters:perform_cascading_failure – True to compute a loadflow after loading the new injections
Returns:
raise GridNotConnexeException:
 If the grid is not connex, matpower raises an error; when an error is

raised after a matpower callback, this exception is raised.
compute_topological_mapping_permutation()[source]¶

Compute a permutation that shuffles the construction order of a topology (prods->loads->lines or->lines ex) into a representation where all elements of a substation are consecutives values (same order, but locally).

disconnect_line(id_line)[source]¶
export_relative_thermal_limits()[source]¶

Computes and returns the relative thermal limits, i.e. the elementwise division of the flows in Ampere by the lines nominal thermal limit.

Returns:a list of size the number of lines of positive values
export_to_observation()[source]¶

Exports the current grid state into an observation.

get_topology()[source]¶
load_scenario(scenario, do_trigger_lf_computation=True, cascading_failure=False)[source]¶

Loads a scenario from class Scenario: contains P and V values for prods, and P and Q values for loads.

Parameters:
  • scenario – an instance of class Scenario
  • do_trigger_lf_computation – True to compute a loadflow after loading the new injections
  • cascading_failure – True to simulate a cascading failure after loading the new injections
Returns:

if do_trigger_lf_computation then the result of self.compute_loadflow else nothing
reconnect_line(id_line)[source]¶
exception pypownet.grid.GridNotConnexeException[source]¶
class pypownet.grid.Topology(prods_nodes, loads_nodes, lines_or_nodes, lines_ex_nodes, lines_service, mapping_permutation=None)[source]¶

This class is a container for the topology lists defining the current topological state of a grid. Topology should be manipulated using this class, as it maintains the adopted convention consistently.

get_length()[source]¶

Module env¶

class pypownet.env.RunEnv(grid_case=118)[source]¶
class ActionSpace(grid_case)[source]¶
sample()[source]¶
verify_action_shape(action)[source]¶
class Observation(active_loads, reactive_loads, voltage_loads, active_productions, reactive_productions, voltage_productions, active_flows_origin, reactive_flows_origin, voltage_flows_origin, active_flows_extremity, reactive_flows_extremity, voltage_flows_extremity, relative_thermal_limit, topology_vector)[source]¶

The class State is a container for all the values representing the state of a given grid at a given time. It contains the following values:

  • The active and reactive power values of the loads
  • The active power values and the voltage setpoints of the productions
  • The values of the power through the lines: the active and reactive values at the origin/extremity of the
    lines as well as the relative thermal limit usage
  • The exhaustive topology of the grid, as a stacked vector of one-hot vectors

load_next_scenario(do_trigger_lf_computation=False, cascading_failure=False)[source]¶

Loads the next scenario, in the sense that it loads the scenario with the smaller greater id (scenarios ids are not necessarly consecutive).

Returns:
raise ValueError:
 raised in the case where they are no more scenarios available
load_scenario(scenario_id, do_trigger_lf_computation, cascading_failure=False)[source]¶
reset(restart)[source]¶

Resets the game: put the grid topology to the initial one. Besides, if restart is True, then the game will load the first set of injections (i_{t0}), otherwise the next set of injections of the chronics (i_{t+1})

Parameters:restart – True to restart te chronic, else pursue with next timestep
reset_grid()[source]¶

Apply the initial topology to the grid.
